page.title: 05Westcott Farm
page.content: This 250 acre farm is owned by Mr. P. Hambly. The main enterprises are{ {beef}and{sheep}production. There are 140 varous crossbred cattle but most are Fresians, Devons, Herefords and some French beef breeds. The beef cattle are slaughtered at about 15-18 months old. About 400 Longwool and Suffolk lambs are kept. In may the sheep are shorn and their fleeces taken to Liskeard{wool}depot. By late spring and summer the lambs are ready to be butchered at 3-5 months old. Mr.Hambly also gows up to 40 acres of barley and{oats}for winter feed and selling to merchants. Intensively grown grass and some maize is grown for silage and hay. This is fed to the catle in winter. The work is very mechanised & is done by the farmer, his son & one employee.
